snippet: Facing unknown consequences if Greece is pushed out of the eurozone, panicked citizens are buying appliances and jewelry, and even prepaying their taxes.
abstract: Greek retailers report surge in number of shoppers buying goods like ovens and refrigerators with debit cards as Greeks face growing fear of possible bank failures; many companies are similarly trying to protect themselves financially by paying off debts to guard against having to pay back money after deposits are affected by any deal to rescue Greek banks.

byline.contributor: Liz Alderman and Dimitris Bounias contributed reporting from Athens.

lead_paragraph: Facing unknown consequences if Greece is pushed out of the eurozone, panicked citizens are buying appliances and jewelry, and even prepaying their taxes.

headline.main: Greeks Spend in Droves, Afraid of Losing Savings to a Bailout
headline.print_headline: Greeks, Fearing Ruin, Go on a Spending Spree
